Detailed Description

Date:
2009-04-24
Author:
Jean-Lou Dupont
This module is the principal interface to LITM. For more information as to the API of this module, please consult litm.h .

Definition in file litm.c.

Function Documentation

int __litm_compute_timeout ( int  timeout  ) 

Translates a seconds based timeout to a useconds timeout value whilst adjusting for the default timeout value.

litm_code litm_disconnect ( litm_connection *  conn  ) 

Disconnects from the ``switch``

Once a client calls this function, no more access with the connection is permitted to any of the following functions:

  • litm_subscribe
  • litm_unsubscribe
  • litm_receive_nb
  • litm_send
  • litm_release

Be sure to release any message in the client's care before disconnecting.

Parameters:
*conn connection reference

Definition at line 78 of file litm.c.

References litm_connection_close().

Here is the call graph for this function:

void* litm_get_message ( litm_envelope *  envlp,
int *  type 
)

Returns a copy of the pointer to the message and the message type

Parameters:
*envlp the envelope from which to extract the pointer to the message
*type pointer to receive message type
This function should be used instead of relying on the ``litm_envelope`` data structure.

** DO NOT** modify the message!

Definition at line 268 of file litm.c.

References _litm_envelope::msg, and _litm_envelope::type.

litm_code litm_receive_nb ( litm_connection *  conn,
litm_envelope **  envlp 
)

Receive (non-blocking) function for clients

Note:
It is the responsibility of the client to _not_ use this function once a connection is closed.

litm_code litm_release ( litm_connection *  conn,
litm_envelope *  envlp 
)

Release a message to LITM

This function should *ONLY* be used by client's as a result of finishing the processing of an envelope/message retrieved through ``litm_receive_nb''.

Definition at line 261 of file litm.c.

References switch_release().

Here is the call graph for this function:

litm_code litm_send ( litm_connection *  conn,
litm_bus  bus_id,
void *  msg,
void(*)(void *msg)  cleaner,
int  type 
)

Send message on a ``bus``

See also:
litm_disconnect
Parameters:
*conn connection reference
bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
*msg the pointer to the message
*cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
type message type
If omitted, the default ``cleaner`` function will be free().

If an error occurs, it is the responsibility of the sender to dispose of the ``messages`` appropriately. If the operation went LITM_CODE_OK, then once all recipients are finished with the message, the ``cleaner`` will be called with the message pointer OR if ``cleaner`` is NULL, the message will simply be freed with free().

Definition at line 98 of file litm.c.

References switch_send().
